freedom_fighters.name: Mahatma Gandhi
freedom_fighters.note: Led India’s non-violent independence movement against British rule.

freedom_fighters.name: Nelson Mandela
freedom_fighters.note: Fought against apartheid and was imprisoned for 27 years.

freedom_fighters.name: Che Guevara
freedom_fighters.note: Played a major role in the Cuban Revolution.

freedom_fighters.name: Bhagat Singh
freedom_fighters.note: A symbol of youth resistance during India’s struggle for independence.

freedom_fighters.name: Harriet Tubman
freedom_fighters.note: Helped enslaved people escape through the Underground Railroad.

politicians.name: Barack Obama
politicians.note: 44th President of the United States and the first African-American president.

politicians.name: Angela Merkel
politicians.note: Led Germany for 16 years as one of the world’s most powerful women.

politicians.name: Winston Churchill
politicians.note: Led Britain during World War II.

politicians.name: Franklin D. Roosevelt
politicians.note: Led the US during the Great Depression and World War II.

leaders.name: Martin Luther King Jr.
leaders.note: Led the American civil rights movement with nonviolent activism.

leaders.name: Malcolm X
leaders.note: Advocated for the rights of Black Americans.

leaders.name: Aung San Suu Kyi
leaders.note: Nobel Peace Prize laureate and leader of Myanmar’s opposition movement.

leaders.name: Jawaharlal Nehru
leaders.note: India’s first Prime Minister and a key figure in the independence movement.

leaders.name: Simón Bolívar
leaders.note: Played a key role in Latin America's successful struggle for independence from the Spanish Empire.
